Posts.Title: not good you guys Fitztwins Lindaip

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2008 05:41PM farmnana wrote: Hi Ellen...I had 4 drains, 2 on each side.  You feel a little pressure, but it really doesn't hurt.  A funny story...my husband was helping me empty my tubes one day and told me I looked like a christmas tree with red bulbs hanging off it.  He said all I need was a star on top of my head.  Just thought I'd share...he made me laugh a lot and that really helped. Congrats on the baby...November 8th is the perfect day...my birthday!!! Deb
Posts.Title: drain removal Elliemae32 sam408

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2008 06:01PM farmnana wrote: Hi Nancy...it's me again!  I see you've changed your mind about the bi-lateral.  I have no regrets that I chose a bi-lateral...it was what was best for me and my peace of mind, as I'm sure it's what you consider was best for you. Dolphinsac...if you have any concerns about your doctor or hospital, please find someone you feel comfortable with.  I had a wonderful doctor and hospital and I feel very lucky.  I felt that they actually cared about me and my needs.  You keep searching until you find that comfort, but don't wait too long.  The sooner you get this monster under control the better you will feel about the whole process.  I wish you the very best. Deb
